subject: p16855430
History: -year-old female with shortness of breath and hypoxia.
Findings: Single portable view of the chest. Left PICC is in stable position, tip in the mid SVC. There has been interval progression of the bilateral parenchymal opacities more so on the left which appears more confluent in the perihilar region most compatible with pulmonary edema. More dense retrocardiac opacity silhouetting the hemidiaphragm suspicious for superimposed effusion. Cardiac silhouette is enlarged but unchanged.
Impression: Progression of pulmonary edema and persistent left effusion. Superimposed infection would be difficult to exclude.
